answers.answer: Atenolol blocks the affect of adrenaline on the heart.  Hopefully, you all will be successful in preventing diabetes with diet, exercise, weight loss if needed.  What can happen if diabetes develops, is if a low blood sugar happens, the body naturally releases adrenaline, to I guess assist in increasing the blood sugar.  A person will develop symptoms of low blood sugar, feeling of anxiosness, sweating, etc..  The Atenolol, since it blocks adrenaline, can lessen some of these symptoms so may not know that have low blood sugar.  Without addressing increasing the low blood sugar, serious things can happen, diabetic coma.  Maybe this doesn't happen often, so doctors are not so concerned or they feel he is doing well on beta blockers, but this can happen on Atenolol.  I would look into the side affects of Atenolol.  Hope things get better.

question: My husband is taking Novasc 10 mg, Atenotol (not sure of dosage) and a durietic 50 plus synthryoid.  He is 57 and is quite active.  He ihas gained weight.  His blood pressure is around 117/74 to 134/84.  He is losing his hair, his short term memory is terrible.  He can ask the same questions over and over.  He is pre-diabetes and we are trying to control it with diet.  He seems to be in denial and doesn't want me to come to the doctor with him.  He didn't have prediabetes before -we just found out.  He has many other apparent side affects but won't admit to them.  His doctor seems to think he is OK on these meds.  I'm concerend about the meds.  Can you tell me if the combination of meds he is taking is dangerous or could be?  His doctor told him he would probably have the same side affects with any hypertension meds.  Is this true?
title: Novasc, Atenolol and duiretic
